Reviews.Title: “not all rooms have a view.”
Reviews.Author: cheercoach247
Reviews.Content: We came here on an Interval International exchange. Our sleeps 6 with a full kitchen on the beach with a great view in Maui was no where near a fair exchange. Although the staff is nice and attentive, the beach is great, the pool chairs are plentiful, nothing will make up for being in a dark room facing the side of another building with views of the garbage below. If we had been given an ocean view and balcony, I would have rated this with 5 circles, but if we open blinds/drapes on either side we are just looking at close buildings and everybody walking by can look in. However the rooms that face the ocean and have balconies look to be nice. The exchanges here are for a specific room so make sure you know what you are getting. Rooms 30 - 32, 20 -22, and 10-12 do not have views.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Blue Green standards”
Reviews.Author: Mitch D
Reviews.Content: Of all the Blue Green properties we have stayed at this was by far the worst. We are owners so we expect better. Old and run down, noisy and seemed like a lot of "old time" condo owners were there. Won't go back. Casa Del Mar was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CAROLYN L
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Dolphin Beach Club. My husband, myself and our two sons (15 & 11) had a wonderful week! We had a studio condo, it was small but cleverly designed to hold a lot more than you would think upon first observation. The kitchen was very small, but I cooked all of our meals except 2, so it is very doable! The condo was very clean, the towels and sheets were all provided and you could get clean towels every couple of days. They had a laundry facility on each of the three floors and there were 3 washers and dryers so it was very easy to do laundry. The staff was very friendly, the pool, deck and hot tub were great.. We really enjoyed playing shuffleboard and of course we really enjoyed the ocean! The beaches were clean and not very crowded. We were surprised that they allowed driving on the beach, something we were not used to. But it turned out to not be a very big deal at all, We would love to go back and highly reccommend this resort. On a side note it was especially awesome because it was all one room, our teenager had no recourse except to hang out and talk to his parents and little brother........an unexpected bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “good trip to Daytona”
Reviews.Author: lsg424
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 children and I stayed here for 4 nights this June. We had an efficiency unit on the 2nd floor. The room was fairly small but not so much that we were miserable. The building is probably 25 -30 years old but was well kept and our room was clean.Our room was beachfront with a nice balcony overlooking the pool. The pool was clean and warm and there are 2 gas grills in a pavilion available although we didn't use them. If you want to sleep on the balcony, bring an air mattress as the chairs there are not conducive to good sleeping; they're comfortable to sit in but not to sleep. The sleeper sofa is not real comfortable; the mattress is pretty thin. We could leave our room and be on the beach in about 3 minutes. The beach was clean and uncrowded. The condo is located a few miles south of downtown Daytona Beach so the neighborhood is a little quieter than the area around the boardwalk. I hadn't been to Daytona in 30 years and it has changed a lot but we all liked it. There are several restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk including but not limited to The Cracked Egg Cafe (real good breakfast) and Crabby Joe's (on the pier-food was pretty good but not great). The staff at Dolphin Beach was courteous and professional. Everything worked and I have no complaints. One word of caution, the one bedroom units are NOT on the beach but instead overlook the parking lot. Efficiencies are the only beachfront units. We would definitely go back and look forward to doing so next year.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty& Nasty...but great view”
Reviews.Author: Geoff H
Reviews.Content: So, where to start. OK, lets start with the positives.;.. the view is fantastic, location is great, you can have your toes in the sand within about 20 steps from any of the rooms. But... make sure you put your shoes on before entering your room. When we arrived we found the "entry" to be tile with a nice shmear of former guests food and drink evenly on the tile... I think they might not have heard of soap... not sure though. Bed was placed not more then 16" from 180 db ac unit thereby blasting one of you with sub zero air while sleeping... we found it more enjoyable to turn off the ac and enjoy the heat and stuffiness of an old school no tell motel. The best was finding what appeared to be a sun tan lotion butt print on the counter between the bed and the "living" space... with something sticky between the leg prints... not making the call on that. I will give props to the manager who watched while three members of his staff "cleaned" the room again as they had no other rooms available. Even after the "re-clean" it was just nasty as we found more and more things that were not up human living standards... Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else... this was really repulsive...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again!!”
Reviews.Author: charlie r
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for our honeymoon and it was GREAT!! We had a beachfront room which is the best the rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful,other guest staying the same time with us were very friendly I loved watching the sun rise and walikng in the sand by the ocean was so romantic you can enjoy your privacy also...it was awesome.We will be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: PepsieLola
Reviews.Content: You can comfortably fit 4 people in this condo. Full kitchen and laundry facilities. The ocean view is perfect. All the condos face the ocean so any room here is picturesque. They have a gazebo with 2 working gas grills so you can go down the street to any of the many grocery stores for dinner items and cook it yourself. We have been coming here since the mid 80's and have enjoyed our stays. But now our grandkids (9) and (15) come with us. We enjoyed the hot whirlpool although it does need a good scrubbing. The pool is just the right size for this resort. Our kids almost never got out. The ocean is just a dozen steps away. The beach is clean and inviting. If there were just one thing I would change with this resort it would be the allowance of smoking every where! can't stand it, but it seems everywhere in Florida we went there were a lot of smokers even Walt Disney World. So if you are looking for a nice homey place with good value and great employees come here. Free parking and internet too!

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: weddle79
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th year renting 1 room for two weeks and 2 rooms for 1 week during speedweeks. Just look forward to coming back to this place, everyone that works at Dolphin gives that little extra all the time. The place is always clean, and always being updated. Already counting the days for our next trip to Dolphin, had 3 new friends with us this year and they really enjoyed their stay. This is just a nice place to enjoy the beach without the crowd. Alot of places close by to eat (Aunt Catfish, North Turn, Port Orange Steakhouse, Famous Philly's Chessesteak, Ker's Winghouse and more.) Thanks Brain and staff for always making our trip excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jamiev01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week, and I can't say enough about it! We stayed in an oceanfront room, which had been recently updated. The kitchen had the following: Fridge, stove, micro, dishwasher, toaster, blender. The kitchen had all the items you'd need to fix meals. our room had a flat screen Sony Bravia tv, and the sofa and cahir were very comfortable. The bed was awesome! The view from the balcony was wonderful. There was also a free laundry room, a workout room, and a common room with a large tv, games and books. The service was wonderful! We hope to stay again next year at the Dolphin Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “great week”
Reviews.Author: jaybird6952
Reviews.Content: this is where stay when we go to daytona didnt know about the airshow that was happing at theend of the week left on fri show on sat wish we knew great sunset and sunrises close to the beach and little noise found the cracked egg for breaksfast great food

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Daytona Beach Shores FL”
Reviews.Author: Fawnham
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews are exactly as it is so I won't duplicate them. It's a great place to stay and will book it again! We stayed in a studio/4 with a full kitchen and had pllenty of room. I just wanted to post pics so you can see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “This is our new "spot!"”
Reviews.Author: Orlandofun6
Reviews.Content: my family and I just stayed at the dolphin for a little getaway. When i first reserved the room I will have to admit that I was a little nervous, but we had such a pleasnt surprise when we arrived! This place was great! so clean! The rooms are nothing special, but they were all that we needed. The atmosphere is great, so quiet! My husband and I sat out on the balcony and just listened to the ocean al night. The only con is that the bathroom doesnt have a fan in it, so the moister (and smells) stick around for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Douglasvillemom
Reviews.Content: We are from Atlanta and we stayed for a week on our vacation and it was nice. The staff was very friendly.The outside pool area was nice also. The hot tub was not clean enough and my kids got itchy from the hot tub so they stayed out of it after that. The condo was small but nice for us - two bathrooms made the condo even better. Could have spent a little more money on a TV for the master bedroom. The dryers need to be better, and I think that is the only complaint I have. You did have to go on Mondays and/or Wednesday's to get fresh towels and other essentials.

Reviews.Title: “Great causal beachfront resort... would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ally4900
Reviews.Content: Dolphin Beach Club is a small, older (converted motel) type resort located right on the Beach in Daytona Beach Shores. If you're looking for a casual laid back resort with a nice pool and beach access you will find it here. Nothing fancy so don't expect the Ritz... our room was an efficiency (1 queen bed and sofa sleeper, one room with divider) we were staying with our 5 year old grandson, and although it was smaller than other resorts, there was enough room for us to get by comfortably.... after all we spent 90% of the time out on the beach. Might be tight with 4 adults. The rooms have recently been updated and the furniture and bed were nice, clean and attractive. Bed was comfortable enough for us. Kitchen very small but I was able to make Mac/cheese, sandwiches, etc with no problem, full size fridge was nice too. Also have gas grills in the pool gazebo for grilling out if you want. Beach resorts always tend to show wear and tear more so than other resorts but they look to be trying to keep this up and in good shape. It is nothing fancy though. Of course the best thing about this resort is the Beach... and second best is the pool and pool area. There was a nice mix of guests during our stay, some elderly people along with some families with younger children and teenagers and there were a couple of young adult groups and honeymooners, so a good mix. Not alot of "planned activities" but after all we are there for the beach. They did provide some pool floats, etc for the kids and Monday morning free coffee and donuts were nice too. The staff was friendly as were most of the guests. Very causal atmosphere. We were on the 3rd floor and had a great view of the ocean, pelicans and even a few dolphins. I am a Bluegreen points member and had leftover points that could only be used at a "red" resort which is why I chose the Dolphin Beach Club. It is not as fancy as the Seabreeze, that is why it is classified as "red" but I would stay here again in the future, would probably try to get two rooms if I was coming with older grandkids or with other adults though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Beachfront Motel for Relaxed Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 2views
Reviews.Content: The resort pool pic on this sites main page is from another resort and state. There are no mountains in Daytona. The actual pool is very nice and is right above the beach. During our stay, even though vehicles are allowed on the beach, the beach was uncrowded and beach auto traffic was minimal. The sand is very fine and when damp or wet, packs hard. Wet or dry, it is a great walking beach, even barefoot; no seaweed, trash, or hard shells to avoid. The resorts beachfront units face Southeast, and the pool is btwn the resort and ocean, so by 4:30PM the sun has crossed to the front of the building, shading the pool. Our unit faced the parking lot rather than the ocean. There is a gazebo bar with 2 gas BBQ grills for guests to use. There is also a hot tub and sauna. The unit was created by combining two motel rooms. There were 2 bathrooms, a bedroom, kitchen and living area with fold out sofa. The unit seemed clean and well maintained with the exception of the stove which had loose burners that wouldnt lay flat. Full fridge, micro, coffee maker, blender, toaster, small elec range and oven (stove top burners were loose and wouldn't lay flat), pans and dishes, dishsoap, and bath soap were included. The kitchen is only big enough for one person at a time. The living area is small because the standard motel room needed to include the kitchen, dining table, livingroom sofa & chair, end tables, TV and dresser. A lot of furniture in a small area. Overall, the unit is quite comfortable for two adults, and maybe an additional small child or two. It would be cramped for four adults. The staff is friendly and accomodating. Daytona Beach Shores is a quieter location than central Daytona Beach; fewer restaurants, bars, stores, etc. Walk a couple blocks and there are three fun eateries under the bridge to the mainland, providing waterfront dining. About a mile north of Dolphin, is Publix supermarket where we found what we needed for preparing our beachfront grilled meals back at the resort. The only significant disappointment was the humidity. Our unit had an air conditioner in the livingroom and one in the bedroom, but although we were able to create a chill in the room, we could not reduce the humidity to a comfortable level. It was so increadibly damp in the room that we could not sleep or get comfortable. We vacation in Florida regularly and we have never had a humidity issue like this before. As nice as the location, pool, and oceanfront location was, I will seek accomodations with better humidity control on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Basic with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: NativeAtlantaGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Dolphin Beach Club twice - in June 2008 for a week and again for two weeks in August 2009. I got a fabulous deal for under $200 a week, so as long as the place was safe and clean, I wasn't going to complain much. It's not the Ritz, but the place is well-run. I had to move from one room to another this time - which was a major pain. The first one's bathroom was nice. The second one's bathroom was... disgusting and very old and in desperate need of updating. The kitchens are 'basic' and the utensils, etc are hit and miss. I had a 'studio' type room - there's a queen bed with an accordian-like room divider if needed. A sofa bed in the other half. It is comfortable for two people. The people next to me had FOUR adults in their room. (I have NO idea how they could manage that.) There is ample storage. I was fortunate to have a ground-floor room - larger balcony - the views were fabulous. However, the convenience of the beach/pool was fabulous. I walked the beach most mornings at sunrise, laid out in the sun all day, came back for a late lunch & shower, and then walked for the sunset. There is a couple of gas grills for use in the pool area - great added feature. Problem is that some people let their music go a little too loud. First week was like the retirement home's version of spring break. Was sort of creeped out by some of the older men staring and making comments when I was minding my own business laying out (in a tasteful bikini). The 2nd week (Labor Day Week) was completely different. Much younger crowd - woman about 200lbs strutting around in a thong. (There were children ALL over the place.) The dynamic of the other guests is quite diverse. The staff is amenable enough. The people that are in charge of the massive cleaning undertaking on Saturdays was... scary and colorful. (Again, if you are coming for one week, won't be an issue.) They provide beach towels for use but they are like complete towel nazis about it. Depending on what you pay for the place, it's decent enough. If you are there for the beach, having a fairly clean and safe place it's okay.

Reviews.Title: “Proud Owners”
Reviews.Author: butchAltoonaPenna_
Reviews.Content: Love The Dolphin Beach Club! Having been an owner for 15 yrs.we acquired a second week . Now we spend 2 wks in march. Sure the place has had it share of ups and downs (hurricanes etc.) But they always manage to keep the guests happy . I have read lots of negative reviews, the only thing I can summarize is some people would never be satisified even if a week were given to them. As far as places to eat I have found lots within walking distance, No night life ? These people must have stayed in their room the entire time . There is a shuttle that runs up into Daytona pretty much all the time .I have raised a family with annual trips to Dolphin Beach Club and these are some of the best times my children and their children will experience.As Always Thank You To Staff Of Dolphin Beach Club Keep Up The GOOD WORK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: weddle79
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd year in a row that we have stayed here for 2 weeks during race week. Last year 4 of us this year 8 of us. More want to come next year. This place is just the greatest. The whole staff from the office, housekeeping, to maintance go out of their way to make your stay just the best that it can be. The veiw of the ocean is just something you have to see for your self, we had a full moon shining on the ocean a few nights and it was just like something you would see in the movies. The same guests keep coming back year after year, and are freindly and remember you. So many places to eat in area, had a hard time picking a place. Cooking out on the deck one night with friends was just great. Dolphin Beach Club is Daytona Beach hidden treasure. Stay small!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look before you book”
Reviews.Author: baker1963
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our vacation for a long time and we were meeting our daughter, who flew down from Chicago and we came in from Las Vegas. When we booked this resort it was because our points required we stay in red season vs. high red. We booked through our vacation club, Bluegreen Corp, and were able to view pictures online so we had an idea what to expect. Well, when we got there we were surprised to find out that not all rooms are oceanfront, even though the website would lead you to think so. Only the studios are oceanfront, the one bedrooms are on the side of the building. Well, when we got into the one bedroom we were shocked to find it a mess. The one chair in the room was flithly and all torn up, The outlets were coming out of the wall, the water in the bedroom bathroom was so low that you couldn't take a proper shower and when we opened up the hideaway bed out popped popcorn and nut shells. The air could only be on low because it sounded liked a mack truck. By the next morning I was in the office because not only the condition of the room but the fact that we wanted a ocean view, that was the one thing we wanted for our vacation. After quite a bit of time they finally decided they weren't quite full and gave us a studio. This room was much better than the one bedroom, clean and in working order. I give props to Joyce in the office, she handled the situation very professionally when I was very upset and ready to check out. It was the week of Daytona 500 so the resort was very full, of old people. I would not recommend this place for families, only for maybe 2-3 people and you have to make sure to get the ocean view, there is nothing like it, we had the door open all night long listening to the water. It was fun to drive on the beach and collect seashells. I would go back but only with my husband and I in the studio villa. They were doing some upgrading so hopefully it will be in better shape if we return. One very important thing I noticed, there is no night life in Daytona Beach and very few places to eat. It was very romantic to watch the sun come up over the Atlantic Ocean and walk on the beach at night during the full moon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the view!!”
Reviews.Author: ripejoga
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week vacation at Daytona Beach. By the look of the Beach Club we didn't expect much because it looked very small but once you get into your room there is more to it. You have a little kitchen fully stocked with pots, utensils, plates and bowls etc. The kitchen also has a working dishwasher, stove, oven, paper towels, a blender, a toaster and fridge. You have a kitchen table, a sofa that pulls out as a bed, a chair, bathroom, a TV with dvd player and a bed. There are places to keep your shoes and so forth next to the bed. There is also a mirror with two dressers. When you exit to the back patio/beach area there are chairs that stretch out so you can sun tan there, lots of tables and chairs, a swimming pool, small jacuzzi and a pretty nice size grill for outdoor BBQ. I was very impressed with the layout and it was right on the beach so you did not have to drive anywhere. There is maid service if you want but it is basically a take care of yourself place. They have a laundrey room available and it is of no cost. They also have a vacuum and broom as well as an ironing board with iron. Overall this is a great place to stay and I would go back again! I highly recommend this place for family, friends or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh just can't beat the sound of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: lestoil
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach. Staff go over and above. Dolphin Beach has overcome "some" issues from the last hurricane and they continue to rectify maintenance requests quickly. We did a time share trade (down) but if you don' t mind a motel motif with a beach/pool in the back yard and closeby Disney attractions, Kennedy Space Center, lots of local excursions, it is a great location. Check the weather and watch for rip tides. Can you hear that ocean ? Ahhhhhhhh

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing without frills”
Reviews.Author: elf.dml
Reviews.Content: The pool and pooldeck is large w/ 2 BBQ's, shuffle boards, sauna and hottub. The beach is long, flat (great for walking/running) sand is white and shellfree. There is no "shopping" around unless souvioners is what you want. Putt-Putt golf is nearby. You want to rent a car. The units mostly oceanfront w/balcony are studios w/ small kitchen, mainly for breakfast/lunch meals but still its nice to have that flexibliity+ a full size refrig. for pop and beer. They have tried to update the rooms but the design/layout looks as if it hasn't changed in 30 years. They have towel replacement 2x per week and fresh pool towels daily. There is a rec. room for kids. Parking is free. Overall if you want a relaxing, low key, no frills, family vacation with sun and fun this is good. If you want "high rent district" and fine dining this is not the hotel or Daytona not the area for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dolphin Beach Club should be titled Beached Dolphin Club”
Reviews.Author: sophiecait
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is the VIEW. We had a studio which overlooked the ocean and you couldn't beat it. Although the place had everything you needed in the room (except a hairdryer, a working electric stove, pass room keys which continually failed us, a DVD player that hummed during use), we still enjoyed our week of 5/27-6/2 due to the weather. The pool/patio area is very nice and the beach without rocks/shells/crabs is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills little getaway”
Reviews.Author: Madcat007
Reviews.Content: We felt that this small resort offered a good value and it was clean. It is somewhat off the beaten path so you'll want to rent a car, however it is just a short distance from many fun spots and does have easy access to the major highways. The on-site pool is surprisingly large for a small resort. While it was fine for us, it doesn't offer alot of space inside. Your room choices are limited to an efficiency which sleeps 2 or a 1 bedroom which sleeps 4. All in all, it is a nice little place.

HotelInfo.Name: Dolphin Beach Club
HotelInfo.Address: 3355 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32018
